Name: For the Love of Physics: From the End of the Rainbow to the Edge of Time - A Journey Through the Wonders of Physics

ReviewList.Text: I bought this book on the recommendation of a review in Natural History magazine.  I gave it to my fourteen year old grandson, and then downloaded it to my own kindle.  We have agreed that the author is leading us further than we had ever gone before in exploring the wonders of our world and universe.  We are also agreed that it is a fascinating journey led by a skilled and imaginative teacher who shares himself as well as his knowledge in this very readable book.

I love this book. I teach high school physics and found myself highlighting so many sections of this book to refer back to when I get to these topics during the year.  He has lots of links to cool websites that illustrate topics he's talking about.  It might be a little hard to read if you haven't taken physics???  But if you remember your basic physics, it's a treasure trove of interesting info.  Really makes you want to have taken his classes at MIT, although as he points out in the book, you can watch him on MIT's website or youtube.  His enthusiam is infectious!  All we physics teachers should strive to make our topic fun and relevant to student's everyday  experiences- which Walter Lewin does.
I am enjoying the book and amazed by Walter Lewin. Everyone, whether old or young, needs to read the book.  I wish that I had read this book when I was much younger.

Walter Lewin has a gift for making Physics approachable - you can see his MIT lectures on YouTube,  I wish he had been there in 1958. Disclaimer: physicists tend to love Physics, and I worked in astrophysics and even a bit with Walter in the late 70s. The bulk of the book deals with his lecture topics, and you will never look at a rainbow the same way again. There is an early chapter on his childhood in wartime Holland and a late one on his interest in art. The rest is on his extraordinary career in x-ray astronomy, which he entered into in its infancy and in which he played a large part. High- energy astrophysics, using satellite detectors of x-rays and gamma rays, has played a large part in our new understanding of the violent universe. Enjoy!

I initially heard a review on PBS and then got the book from the library.  It was so good for an old codger like me who first had physics 60 years ago that I bought it and have recommended it to many others.  What knowledge and can make it so understandable.
Outstanding book! The kind of teacher we all should have had (I was lucky to have one in High School like him).  Highly recommended.

Although I never took a course from Dr. Lewin, I have watched some of his classes on YouTube.  I felt privileged to be able to read this book and get to know the professor a little better.  As a starting teacher in a second career, Dr. Lewin is an inspiring figure.  Plus, after reading the book, I am a much better rainbow finder; the book gives fun tips on finding them.
Reading this book has been an adventure not only in Physics, but also into the concept of Education. I would highly recommend it to stimulate latent potential abilities among students.

I studied physics so I don't mind the math.  But, describing the physics of our universe in the language of a 5, 10, 20, or 50 year old who does not possess a background in math is a true accomplishment.  Comprehending some basics of physics opens the door to a truly fascinating universe.  Walter Lewin is not a physics professor; he is an artist showing the reader a new way to view nature.

After watching most of Professor Lewin's open courseware videos I decided to purchase his book.  His voice and excitement in the lectures permeates through his writing as well!  "For the Love of Physics" is a great read and only helped to motivate me to learn more about the wonders of this world.

Wow. Count me in as a Walter Lewin fan. I would be a scientist or engineer today if I had experienced his teaching earlier in life. Excellent read for those with a natural curiosity about how our world works.

A good reading for those who have had some exposure to Physics and Astronomy especially at the university level. The use of differential equations to explain some of the concepts can be confusing to those with little knowledge of math but nevertheless the author explains natural occurring events around us in lay terms and does a good job.
This is a great book for anyone who loves physics. Lewin's videos are back online again at: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCiEHVhv0SBMpP75JbzJShqw

Professor Lewin is a brilliant physics teacher. I loved his book, but then I love physics in good part to Dr. Lewin's lectures at MIT. Some people felt like there were two parts to the book; Dr. Lewin's love of physics and his research in astrophysics. A good part of his early research using balloons to observe x-ray emitters was done in Palastine, Texas near where I grew up. I saw those balloons constantly (most were studying weather) and became fascinated by Dr. Lewin's work when I realized I was reading about research that was conducted, literally in my back yard. This is not your Stephen Hawking or Brian Greene "pop" physics book. It is about the love of physics by an excellent teacher and researcher.

I'm giving it two stars out of politeness, but really for me it may be closer to a one. I am three chapters in, and there's been very little about physics. It's all autobiographical, and he projects a literary personality that seems vain, egocentric, conceited, and relentlessly self-promoting. I imagine Professor Lewin is not really like this, but I'm reviewing the book not the man. I honestly with I hadn't bought this and bought some other popular physics book that focused more on science and less on the personality of a single scientist, and want to wan potential readers to try to determine if this will be a problem for them before they part with their money.
In my humble opinion, lots of potatoes and not enough meat.  Too much detail in some cases, not enough in others.  The prof does have some interesting quirks and an ego to match.

Though not the most scientifically detailed popular physics book on the market, this is surely one of the most gleefully enthusiastic.  WL is an MIT institution.  No wonder.  His love of his discipline reverberates on every page of this quick reading pop science memoir/primer.  WhatI wouldn't give to take a course with this guy!  Luckily, his intro physics class is available online.  One of these days, I'll get around to watching his lectures.  Books like this inspire one to learn.  Great read!

For anyone who has yet to discover Walter Lewin, I can only offer that he is a treasure. In retirement now from MIT, we can still watch his lectures on YouTube in the MIT OpenCourseware lectures that are absolutely riveting. The book is mostly outtakes from his lectures except for a glimpse of his early childhood in Europe during WWII. If you want to learn why rainbows appear like they do, why pendulums swing like they do and so much more, For the Love of Physics is a must read.
This book reawakens the soul to the wonders of the world, and is a testimony to the power of great teaching - a true masterpiece.
An easy read by an educator who clearly loves his subject. I learned a lot and enjoyed the journey.
Enjoyable read. Would definitely recommend to someone just getting interested in physics. Definitely wish he had been my physics professor!

I love this book. He is so so very right and so brilliant. The book is wonderfully written. Physics is around us -- it's in everything. Lewin is everything a teacher should be: a motivator, a person who gets you to ask "why" and "how" -- and he knows how to not just explain but demonstrate. Watch some of his YouTube videos. They are viewed the world over. He practiced for those demonstrations (as seen on YouTube) for hours before he exhibited experiments in class. He came from a tough background. Read the book and you'll understand. Those videos are a main reason why I bought the book. If I enjoyed the videos enough to watch them more than once...what does he have to say on paper? I wanted to know and was not disappointed and you won't be either. If you have a teen interested in science and engineering (my daughter is) -- read it as a family, chapter by chapter. It's a wonderful way to connect on something technical, share thoughts and ideas -- and ponder the world we live in.

It starts with some basic physics discussion that explains  some natural phenomena we often observe.  The chapters on x-Ray emission and neutron stars was worth the book.  A portion of the book discusses the author's personal life and experiences, which is sometimes interesting and sometimes not so.

Humble yet ambitious. Simple yet comprehensive. Professor Lewin passionate and sincere approach to teaching physics leaves the reader clamoring for a sequel to this book. Professor Lewin will be known one day ,I have no doubt, as one of the greatest teachers humanity has had. This book is truly a work of art!

Made famous on Youtube for his dramatic physics lectures at MIT, Lewin has written this book on physics - for everyman.  Its a fascinating world as Lewin takes you through it. His demos are listed and you can see them all on YouTube.  He is also a first rate researcher on Astrophysics and for me his chapters on X-rays, stars, black holes and so on were fascinating. He also does his best explaining the nano world of atoms including his thoughts on string theory.  A side chapter on art is also a treat as he explains the role of artists teaching us to see differently.  A fun and educational read - even if you know nothing about math and physics.

I first started to watch the MIT video of professor Walter's last class on my computer and in the middle of that video, I was so excited about the way that he was teaching in his class that I decided to buy his book for my Kindle. Anyway, I purchased the book before the end of that video and since then I have enjoyed reading it. It is very well written and explains very complex physics problems in an easy way. I liked his style of teaching. He is an amazing professor.
It is one of the most interesting books I have ever read. If you want to change your life - read it
Even though parts of this book are way above my ability to understand, it still holds my interest.  Professor Levin is a great storyteller.
That is a teacher, all we need....good teachers. The energy and passion that Professor Lewin trasnmit is vital in a goor class environment

This book is great, either on its own, or as a supplement to the video lectures on ocw.mit.edu. Reading this book is like having a tutorial from the instructor. However,I would recommend a good wireless connection,as there are many links to illustrate key points.
It is a superb book with an excellent gist of ll physics topics presented in a way meant to capture your attention and interest. It succeeds in what the book has been written for

His book really brings out the personality that I imagined from listening to his lectures. I recommend it to everyone, but particularly to parents who are trying to raise children. It could spark an interest that will at least guide them through life and might even encourage them to become a scientist.

I have always been interested in physics and this book helped me see the world in a different way... a physics way the book is very educational and isnt just for people who know about physics this book can help you learn about the subject. Walter Lewin is an amazing writer!!!

This is an incredible book from a masterful teacher.  You will be amazed at the things you will learn about the world around you.  Lewin has a gift for making complex subjects understandable and interesting.  You will never look at your surroundings the same way again.

Lewin makes physics come alive and is understandable by the layperson (i.e., me). I've been marking spots for my daughter to use in the high school physics class that she teaches.  I wish I had studied under Lewin, not the poor teacher I had in high.school physics.

This book is a must read for anyone who loves Physics. Walter Lewin is really a genius when it comes to teaching concepts, as we can see from his lectures at MIT. In this book he drives into thinking (a little bit) like he does, and its just wonderful.

Great book from a great writer. It gives a deeper and personal insight of the lectures and professional life of Walter Lewing, with all the dynamics of teaching so characteristic of him. I recomend it.
Unless you just have no time for youtube, you would be better off watch the same on youtube and actually see the demonstrations.  These would be an exciting presentation for high school students.
Excelent as all MIT lectures from Sir Walter Lewin,he makes Physics simple and atrative as possible, very good book. Thank you!
Walter Lewin is an amazing person.  His passion and love for physics is shown through his way of teaching! An amazing journey! Recommended to anyone interested in science.
I do not know of another person who has contributed more to teaching fraternity than Walter Lewin. He has made Physics so simple to understand for everyone.
Lewin (from MIT) is a consomate educator of science. He will make you love science if you don't already. Read it and then watch his  MIT free course
This book was purchased for my husband who has an interest in physics.  He is enjoying the information and discusses physics with a friend of his.
CLEAR  AND  UNDERSTANDABLE  AS  THE  VERY WELL  KNOWN  MIT  W.LEWIN LECTURES  BUT  THE  SUBJECTS IT  TREATS  ARE  FULLY INTERESTING  ALSO!
That is perfect, product in good, the shippement tooks 2 weeks which is nice and sweet. That is it! word.
It seemed to me not very well written and very boring -- but that's just me.
The most interesting, entertaining science book I've ever read
Great product, service and I would recommend it to friends.
Inspiring! I learn the basis to be happy with my job
Love Walter Lewin. Great book. Love his MIT lectures
I loved this book.  Bravo !
Quick & as represented.
The simplest explanations of everyday phenomena. All the things you wanted to know. Any age group can read this book.
This is a fun, informative, and helpful (for understanding Physics) book!  The author has an amazing gift for making Physics understandable and fun.
Dr Lewin has produced an in depth, interesting and sometimes amusing look at the world of physics.  Clear examples and encourages use of his online course and supplements.
Lewis is great. Watch him on You Tube and get an idea of his teaching. The book is great! I highly recommend.
